posts.author: Valkos
posts.content:
I was looking through some of the assassin builds in 40s list and there were none atr based assassins to my surprise.

What is your guys take on the validity of a str sneaker and perhaps more so a str based assassin?

I was thinking that a low magic server with would be amazing for a str based assassin in PvM environments and a little less when it comes to PvP. Get HIPS and IKD and only so few things will stand in your way.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
None?
You hurt my feelings Valkos,
Here is a 40-strength one for your consideration,
The Stingray => code-name-stingray-bard-9-rdd-10-assass ... .html#p779

And here is a 30-strength one, but he is also a weapons-master as well,
Shadow Avenger => shadow-avenger-ftr-12-ass-21-wm-7-t2354412.html#p801

And here is another 30-strength Assassin with properly high DC as well, this time a Ranger,
Night-Raider => the-night-raider-ftr-10-asn-25-rng-5-t2354423.html#p812

Finally, not an Assassin but a shadow-warrior type with massive AB & HiPS and actually (gulp) good saves for a weapons-master,
Shadow Warrior => the-shadow-warrior-fighter-8-shadow-dan ... .html#p696

Apart from all these though, what do I think about the validity of strength-based sneakers depends a lot on the magic-level of the server.
Go all the way up to medium-high(ish) and strength is King & Queen for just about everything, after that though...
Dexterity-based, ED, SCV all the way.

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content: In PnP your victim has to be 'unaware' for the paralysis in Death Attack to work, not merely flat-footed; not sure how that's been handled in NWN.

My eyes must be getting old... ;)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
If it helps on the search side, there are three useful threads you can avail yourself of -

Empyre65's "The Epic Character Build Search Engine is back!" (here in the General Discussion section)

And 2 from HipRedux (both in the Rules and Tools section): "ECB Guild Filter" and "How and Where to Access Legacy ECB Archives".

Cheers

EDIT: I will say that, unfortunately, the ECB Guild Filter only covers every finalized build posted on this forum up to January 2017. Alas, Hip has subsequently gone a-wandering.

posts.content: The list would not be complete without the commando lizard. It's an old build ( I think it's pre-1.69?), but really amazing. Also, DWARF SHIFTER ASSASSIN ACTION!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Thorsson wrote: In PnP your victim has to be 'unaware' for the paralysis in Death Attack to work, not merely flat-footed; not sure how that's been handled in NWN.
In NWN,  the victim has to be out of combat for Death Attack's parlysis to work.  Otherwise, it is just like Sneak Attack.

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:
Thorsson wrote: In PnP your victim has to be 'unaware' for the paralysis in Death Attack to work, not merely flat-footed; not sure how that's been handled in NWN.
In NWN,  the victim has to be out of combat for Death Attack's parlysis to work.  Otherwise, it is just like Sneak Attack.
So, you only get one chance to paralyse - if you do so from hiding? I assume that once you're seen the game places you in combat. If your hiding skills are poor then you may never get a Death Attack, it'll be just like a 'normal' Sneak Attack.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You would be correct in PnP but in Neverwinter Nights because the "round" is divided into three instances "we call them, flurries" you get as many opportunities as your attack(s) in the first flurry.
That is directly relevant to the number of attacks your character has, below is a short chart for your consideration.

2 attacks -> 1 /1 /0
3 attacks -> 1 /1 /1
4 attacks -> 2 /1 /1
5 attacks -> 2 /2 /1
6 attacks -> 2 /2 /2
7 attacks -> 3 /2 /2
8 attacks -> 3 /3 /2
9 attacks -> 3 /3 /3
10 attacks -> 4/ 3/ 3

Note: In Neverwinter Nights - Enhanced Edition, the answer would always be "One" because that feature deemed a "Bug" and they "Fixed" it.

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content: When I said one attempt, I was meaning one flurry, not one attack (note to self - must be clearer). I didn't know they'd fixed that in EE.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Aye, and the complete answer is more complicated than that.
For example, due to the limitations of the engine, detections skills don't exactly work as they should Unless you're an Elf and that is why the lean-ones are preferred in PvP (for certain builds).

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Aye, and the complete answer is more complicated than that.
For example, due to the limitations of the engine, detections skills don't exactly work as they should Unless you're an Elf and that is why the lean-ones are preferred in PvP (for certain builds).
Is this related to Keen Sense? Someone once told me they check twice as often as other Races - is that correct?

Does Beamdog intend to do anything about it, I wonder?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Right, not only that but they receive the full skill all the time while anyone else rolls d10+half the relevant skill when they aren't standing still or using "search mode" which slows them greatly.
But who can stand still when he/she is fighting?
For the second part, I hope they do, eventually.
